oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Typical living quarters, Powell's Station

oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Conservation of natural resources
Civilian Conservation Corps (U.S.); New Deal, 1933-1939
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Inside of a Civilian Conservation Corps barracks at Powell's Station, Tennessee. Foot lockers are at the foot of each bunk. Laundry bags, containing dirty clothes, hang from the walls.; Many of the bunks are arranged with alternating feet and heads.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Spencer & Wycoff
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The foot lockers at the foot of each bunk were to contain the workers' personal items nd clothing. The alternating head and feet pattern of the bunks was to keep the workers from talking to each other at night. It was also thought to slow the spreading of germs.
